text: today's recipe is a really easy and
delicious rib recipe and all of it is
made right in your kitchen in your
air-conditioning in your oven it has
three separate herbs thyme sage and
rosemary as well as some fennel seed and
paprika so it's sort of inspired by like
the Italian porchetta in rib before
you'll need two teaspoons each chopped
fresh thyme and chopped sage as well as
two tablespoons of chopped fresh
rosemary so I'm getting those herbs
ready if you don't have those fresh
herbs I think you could use some dry
especially for the thyme and the sage
but I would do about half rosemary same
want to remove the needles from the sort
of tougher stock in the center so pull
those off before you mince up the
rosemary I like to use more tender
rosemary if I can find it as opposed to
the woodier stuff because if I'm gonna
chop it up I'm gonna eat it as part of a
rub you don't want to be getting stuck
stuck in the mouth with little bits of
rosemary but do your best that's why the
replacing the fresh with dry just for
the rosemary is not the best idea
because those are really really pokey
have you ever tried to eat a piece of
dry rosemary not fun
chop the herbs so they're pretty fun
sage same thing chop that two teaspoons
final chop all together then they're
gonna go into a bowl with a quarter cup
of olive oil four teaspoons of kosher

using three racks of ribs so just
remember it's getting distributed and
kosher salt is less salty than fine salt
a teaspoon of black pepper four

as two teaspoons of hot pepper ether I

you're gonna cook these start preheating

and wash your hands
once I've marinated uncover them and
then roast them until they're tender at
325 that'll take about two hours for the

you're gonna grate the garlic you can
grate it directly into the bowl sort of
a glaze I mean we're glazing the ribs
with it it's not your traditional glaze
not syrupy or a thick or anything but
it's gonna add just a final touch of

other oil now you're gonna want to brush

ahead you want to cook them up to this

can refrigerate them for a day or two
before you reheat them in the broiler
and then just back into the broiler
until they're nice and crispy and sort
